alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Harding; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:31PM MDT until July 11 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Harding County in northeastern New Mexico... Northeastern Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 431 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain just east of Springer along Highway 56. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Colfax, Northwestern Harding and Northeastern Mora Counties FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
